DOC.brief_summary: Giving infiltration analgesia around the neck of the womb (= paracervical block, PCB) is frequently experienced as a painful procedure by women undergoing follicle aspiration. Two sedation protocols, where in the one protocol a low dose of alfentanil hydrochloride is already administered before the PCB, will be compared with each other and pain relief measured using the 'Visual Analogue Scale' and the 'Short-Form McGill Questionnaire'
DOC.brief_title: Pain Evaluation During Follicle Aspiration: Comparison of Two Sedation Protocols
DOC.criteria: Healthy women and female infertility patients Between 18 and 43 years of age Patients with a known allergy to alfentanil hydrochloride or comparable drugs (morphine, cocaine)
